citations.narrative:
The facility is not following their Program of Vet Care (PVC) as written by the Attending Veterinarian for vaccinations. The
PVC prescribes for adult dogs to receive vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus yearly.
The facility reports that female dogs are given a “5 way” or “7 way” vaccine (which contain distemper and parvovirus) at
the time of their pre-breeding exam, which occurs before a dog enters its estrus cycle (also known as “going into heat”).
Female dogs cycle approximately every 6 months. Which means, a dog may be getting vaccinated twice a year, not
yearly as the PVC prescribes. It is also possible a dog goes longer than a year for their vaccination, depending on when
the dog was acquired into the kennel, the timing of previous vaccination, or with the timing of pregnancy and weaning.
Additionally, six adult male dogs are not up to date on their distemper and parvovirus vaccinations:
- “Tinker” #5368 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.
- “Wiley” #9139 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.
- “Grover” #7935 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.
- “Puddles” #0332 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.
- “Jasper” #7935 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.
- “Dallas” #5051 has no recorded history of the distemper/parvovirus vaccinations.
Failure to follow the PVC for vaccination scheduling leaves the dogs susceptible to diseases, which, if contracted, would
cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by administering all of the vaccines required by the Animal Welfare Act
(distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine
manufacturer recommendations. Correct by: January 21, 2025, onward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following their Program of Vet Care (PVC) as written by the Attending Veterinarian for vaccinations. The 
PVC prescribes for adult dogs to receive vaccinations for distemper and parvovirus yearly.  
 
The facility reports that female dogs are given a “5 way” or “7 way” vaccine (which contain distemper and parvovirus) at 
the time of their pre-breeding exam, which occurs before a dog enters its estrus cycle (also known as “going into heat”). 
Female dogs cycle approximately every 6 months. Which means, a dog may be getting vaccinated twice a year, not 
yearly as the PVC prescribes. It is also possible a dog goes longer than a year for their vaccination, depending on when 
the dog was acquired into the kennel, the timing of previous vaccination, or with the timing of pregnancy and weaning.  
 
Additionally, six adult male dogs are not up to date on their distemper and parvovirus vaccinations:  
-  “Tinker” #5368 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.  
-  “Wiley” #9139 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.  
-  “Grover” #7935 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.  
-  “Puddles” #0332 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.  
-  “Jasper” #7935 last had the distemper/parvovirus vaccination (“5 way”) on 7/20/23. It was due again on 7/20/24.  
 - “Dallas” #5051 has no recorded history of the distemper/parvovirus vaccinations. 
 
Failure to follow the PVC for vaccination scheduling leaves the dogs susceptible to diseases, which, if contracted, would 
cause pain, distress, and suffering. Correct by administering all of the vaccines required by the Animal Welfare Act 
(distemper, parvovirus, and rabies) in accordance with a schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian and vaccine 
manufacturer recommendations. Correct by: January 21, 2025, onward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
 n
